conclusion: Analyze forces to ensure maximum static friction between A and B is not exceeded.
Block A is on top of block B, and a force F is applied horizontally to block B.
Weight of block A is 10 N.
Normal force on block A is 10 N.
Frictional force prevents A from moving relative to B.
Weight of block B is 20 N.
Normal force on block B is 30 N.
Frictional force prevents B from moving relative to the ground.
Force F acts horizontally on block B.
Maximum static frictional force between A and B is 1 N.
Coefficient of kinetic friction between B and ground is 0.1.
Maximum static frictional force between B and ground is 3 N.
For A and B to remain stationary relative to each other, F must be less than or equal to 1 N.
Final condition is F does not exceed 1 N.
